Subsequently, these employees are tasked with actions (e.g., 'build a performance culture', 'build an agile...organisation') that directly influence the Organizational scale, demonstrating an Individual -> Organizational link. Only two distinct scales (Individual and Organizational) were explicitly involved in these causal interactions.

Full Paragraph Text: These priorities still underpin everything we do. Our people are also the embodiment of the Unilever Sustainable Living Plan (USLP) – without their commitment and belief, the business could not achieve the plan’s three main goals of improving health and well-being, reducing our environmental impact and enhancing livelihoods. More than 75% of employees say they can contribute to the USLP in their roles and help realise our Vision.
claude4: Scale Explanations: Individual: Employees (75% of them) who express commitment and belief in contributing to sustainability goals; Organizational: Unilever as a company with its Sustainable Living Plan (USLP) and business goals
claude4: Summary: [Individual, Organizational] Employee commitment enables Unilever to achieve its Sustainable Living Plan goals.
claude4: Rationale: The paragraph explicitly states that without employee commitment and belief, the business could not achieve its sustainability plan goals, establishing clear Individual -> Organizational causality. The 75% statistic reinforces this causal relationship by showing widespread individual contribution to organizational objectives.

gpt5: Rationale: The text explicitly ties employees’ commitment to the business’s ability to achieve the USLP, and defines those achievements as changes to health, environment, and livelihoods. This yields a causal chain requiring two pairwise links.

Full Paragraph Text: This independent measure reveals our success at engaging with future leaders which has been driven in part by our Future Leaders League. This is a global competition in which universities around the world send a representative team of undergraduates to our Four Acres campus in Singapore. They are each set a demanding case study to run one of our brands, which in 2014 was TRESemmé, with a strong sustainability theme.

The company's program causally drives engagement with these future leaders.

Full Paragraph Text: Critical to our success are leaders equipped to deliver our Vision and USLP. Full Paragraph Text: Guided and supported by some of the world’s top thought leaders, UL2020 identifies some of Unilever’s most critical challenges and asks small, diverse leadership teams to create solutions. These projects, called Purpose to Impact Initiatives, are structured programmes that deliver individual and wider business development consistent with our commercial and social aims.

Full Paragraph Text: Every year, our people nominate ‘Unilever heroes’ for work that brings our Purpose to life. Anila Gopal, Global Social Mission Manager for Lifebuoy, based in India, is a Unilever hero. She is helping to run the world’s largest handwashing behaviour change programme that demonstrates how using soap could help save children from deadly, but preventable, diseases.

While Anila runs a large-scale program, the causal relationship described is the company's recognition system affecting the individual employee.

Full Paragraph Text: We identified key internal processes where time and effort could be reduced. A significant saving was the time spent on Performance & Development Planning assessments. By reducing and simplifying the number of steps involved, we saved an estimated 200,000 employee hours.
claude4: Scale Explanations: Organizational: The company/organization that identified internal processes and implemented changes to reduce steps in Performance & Development Planning assessments; Individual: The employees whose time and effort was reduced through the simplified assessment process
claude4: Summary: [Organizational, Individual] Company process simplification saves 200,000 employee hours in assessments.
claude4: Rationale: The paragraph describes a clear causal relationship where organizational-level process changes (reducing and simplifying assessment steps) directly resulted in individual-level benefits (saved employee time and effort). This represents a straightforward cross-scale interaction from organizational policy to individual outcomes.

Full Paragraph Text: Elsewhere, over 2013-14, there has been a 51% reduction in the number of internal reports prepared for leadership teams, releasing time to focus on more productive activity. We also simplified the GPS which we ask all employees to complete annually, enabling us to cut the time individuals spent completing the survey significantly.

gpt5: Rationale: The text explicitly states that the organization simplified the GPS, which cut individuals' survey time. The 'releasing time' from fewer reports lacks a clear individual-level subject, so it was excluded.

Full Paragraph Text: In 2013 we successfully ran the Winning Together Campaign to drive more inclusive and efficient ways of working among teams in the organisation. Building on that, in 2014 we launched a second campaign called Time Saving Idea to make simplification a habit and encouraged employees to try simple time-saving ideas. As a result more than 10,000 ideas were tried and rated by our employees.
claude4: Scale Explanations: Organizational: The organization launched campaigns (Winning Together Campaign, Time Saving Idea campaign) as formal organizational initiatives; Individual: Employees participated by trying and rating ideas, representing individual-level responses to organizational initiatives
claude4: Summary: [Organizational, Individual] Organization's Time Saving Idea campaign led employees to try and rate over 10,000 ideas.
claude4: Rationale: The paragraph describes a clear causal relationship where organizational campaigns directly influenced individual employee behavior. The organization's launch of campaigns caused employees to participate by trying and rating ideas, demonstrating explicit cross-scale causality from organizational to individual level.

gpt5: Summary: [Organizational, Individual] Campaigns encouraged employees, causing them to try and rate 10,000 time-saving ideas.
gpt5: Rationale: The text explicitly states the organization encouraged employees via a campaign, resulting in employee actions. Other described effects (on teams) are intra-organizational and thus same-scale, so excluded.
o4_mini: Rationale: No explicit cross-scale causal links are present in the text; all actions are confined to the organizational scale.

Full Paragraph Text: During 2013-14 we completed 30 Talent & Organisation assessments in 69 countries, across four categories and three functions, to identify global themes and risks that need addressing and the capabilities required.

Full Paragraph Text: Key issues include replenishing the talent pipeline as we promote people. We need new talent in the business and to accelerate their development. Full Paragraph Text: In the supply chain we have taken a broad approach to building capabilities for our employees. This includes a host of skills development programmes for blue and white collar employees. Training in core skills is mandatory across 130 roles. Skill assessments are completed every two years and the data is used to understand and address specific gaps across roles, capabilities and geographies.

The company's systematic approach to capability building creates a direct causal influence from the organizational level to individual workers.

Full Paragraph Text: Our aim is to improve the safety and well-being not only of our employees, but also of the wider community in which Unilever operates, with our Vision Zero strategy – zero fatalities, zero injuries, zero motor vehicle accidents, zero process incidents, zero tolerance of unsafe behaviour and practices – serving as our foundation. To meet our commitments, we assess and reduce risk through a variety of programmes, including our continued work to address behaviour safety, process safety, safe travel and construction safety.
claude4: Rationale: The paragraph describes Unilever's safety strategy and programs but does not establish explicit causal relationships between different scales. While it mentions employees (Individual scale) and the wider community (Environmental and Societal scale), it only states Unilever's aim to improve their safety rather than describing how one scale causally influences another. The text presents organizational goals and methods without demonstrating cross-scale causality.
gpt5: Scale Explanations: Organizational: Unilever and its Vision Zero strategy/programmes are organizational actions.; Individual: Employees are specific people affected by those actions.
gpt5: Summary: [Organizational, Individual] Unilever’s Vision Zero and safety programmes reduce risk to employees, improving their safety.
gpt5: Rationale: The text explicitly states Unilever implements programmes to assess and reduce risk, aiming to improve employees’ safety. Although it also mentions the wider community, we limit to two scales per instruction.
o4_mini: Scale Explanations: Organizational: Unilever is a specific organization implementing safety strategies.; Environmental and Societal: The wider community refers to societal-level systems impacted by Unilever's actions.
o4_mini: Summary: [Organizational, Environmental and Societal] Unilever's safety strategies impact the wider community's well-being.
o4_mini: Rationale: The link exists as Unilever's organizational actions directly aim to enhance the safety and well-being of the broader community, establishing a clear cross-scale interaction.
gemini2.5: Links: Organizational -> Individual | Organizational -> Environmental and Societal
gemini2.5: Scale Explanations: Individual: 'employees' refers to specific people, fitting the individual scale.; Organizational: 'our' and 'we' refer to Unilever, a single company, and its internal strategies ('Vision Zero strategy', 'continued work'), which are all part of the organizational scale.; Environmental and Societal: 'wider community' denotes a societal-level system, aligning with the environmental and societal scale.
gemini2.5: Summary: [Individual, Organizational, Environmental and Societal] Unilever (Organizational) aims to improve the safety and well-being of its employees (Individual) and the wider community (Environmental and Societal) through risk reduction efforts.
gemini2.5: Rationale: The paragraph details Unilever's (Organizational) explicit aims to positively influence two distinct scales: its 'employees' (Individual) and the 'wider community' (Environmental and Societal). These are direct, explicit causal influences, where the organization acts with the intent to improve conditions for actors at different hierarchical levels. The phrasing 'not only... but also' suggests the community impact is an expansion of their critical scope, making it the most critical link in terms of broad impact.

Full Paragraph Text: In 2014, we introduced a step change in our Safe Travel programme. With more people on the road than ever before, including many in developing countries where there is a higher risk of car accidents, we released a revised and strengthened travel standard that includes programmes and strategies specifically targeted at high and medium risk locations. By the middle of 2015, we will also have in place a mandatory global ban on using all hand-held and hands-free mobile phone devices while driving on company business.
claude4: Scale Explanations: Organizational: The company ('we') that introduced the Safe Travel programme and implemented travel standards and mobile phone bans; Individual: Employees who must comply with the travel standards and mobile phone ban while driving on company business
claude4: Summary: [Organizational, Individual] Company implements travel standards and mobile phone ban affecting employee driving behavior.
claude4: Rationale: The paragraph describes clear organizational policies (travel standards and mobile phone ban) that directly influence individual employee behavior while driving on company business. Both links represent the same directional relationship but involve different policy mechanisms.
gpt5: Links: Environmental and Societal -> Organizational | Organizational -> Individual
gpt5: Scale Explanations: Environmental and Societal: Societal conditions: more people on the road and higher accident risk in developing countries; Organizational: The company ('we') issuing standards and bans; Individual: Employees driving on company business subject to the ban
gpt5: Summary: [Environmental and Societal, Organizational, Individual] Societal traffic risk prompted the company’s new travel standard, and its phone-use ban constrains employee driving behavior.
gpt5: Rationale: The text explicitly ties societal accident risk to the company releasing a revised standard, and it specifies a mandatory ban that affects employees’ driving behavior. These are direct cross-scale causal statements; no other clear cross-scale links are stated.
o4_mini: Scale Explanations: Organizational: The Safe Travel programme is an initiative by an organization aimed at improving travel safety.; Environmental and Societal: The mention of developing countries and the risk of car accidents indicates a societal-level concern.
o4_mini: Summary: [Organizational, Environmental and Societal] The Safe Travel programme targets safety improvements in high-risk locations.
o4_mini: Rationale: The link exists as the organizational initiative directly addresses societal safety concerns in developing countries, creating a clear cross-scale interaction.
gemini2.5: Links: Environmental and Societal -> Organizational | Organizational -> Individual
gemini2.5: Scale Explanations: Individual: Refers to 'people on the road' and implicitly 'drivers on company business' whose 'using mobile phone devices' is targeted by the ban.; Organizational: Refers to 'we' (the company), 'our Safe Travel programme', 'travel standard', 'programmes and strategies', and 'global ban'.; Environmental and Societal: Refers to 'developing countries' as a geographic context and 'higher risk of car accidents' as a societal safety concern and 'more people on the road' as a demographic trend.
gemini2.5: Summary: [Environmental and Societal, Individual, Organizational] Societal conditions prompted the organization to implement a travel standard, which includes a ban directly impacting individual driver behavior.
gemini2.5: Rationale: Two explicit cross-scale causal links were identified. The first link demonstrates how societal and environmental factors (risk, demographics) motivate an organizational response. The second link shows a direct top-down influence where an organizational policy (the ban) directly changes individual behavior. These three scales (Individual, Organizational, Environmental and Societal) cover all actors explicitly mentioned in a causal relationship.

Full Paragraph Text: This year saw considerable advancement in our behavioural-based approach to health and safety, with 84% of our manufacturing and 38% of our non-manufacturing sites now having rolled out the first phase of the BeSafE programme. This includes training 79 master coaches and 91 trainers, who have in turn trained more than 1,840 employees.

claude4: Summary: [Organizational, Individual] Company's BeSafE programme rollout trains coaches and employees in health and safety.
claude4: Rationale: The paragraph describes a clear hierarchical interaction where the organizational-level BeSafE programme implementation directly causes training outcomes at the individual level (coaches, trainers, and employees). The causality is explicit through the rollout leading to specific training numbers.
gpt5: Scale Explanations: Organizational: The company/sites rolled out the BeSafE programme and provided training.; Individual: Master coaches, trainers, and employees are specific people receiving/providing training.
gpt5: Summary: [Organizational, Individual] The company’s BeSafE programme trained master coaches and trainers, influencing individual behavior/capability.
gpt5: Rationale: The text explicitly states the program trained specific people, a direct organizational-to-individual causal effect. We exclude the trainers training employees because it is individual-to-individual (same scale) and thus out of scope.
o4_mini: Scale Explanations: Organizational: The BeSafE programme is implemented at the organizational level across manufacturing and non-manufacturing sites.; Individual: Employees are the individuals being trained as part of the programme.
o4_mini: Summary: [Organizational, Individual] The BeSafE programme's rollout at the organizational level influences employee training.
o4_mini: Rationale: The link exists as the organizational implementation of the BeSafE programme directly results in the training of individual employees. No other scales are present.
gemini2.5: Scale Explanations: Organizational: Refers to the company's 'manufacturing and non-manufacturing sites' and the 'BeSafE programme', which are units/initiatives within a single organization.; Individual: Refers to specific people such as 'master coaches and trainers' and 'employees'.
gemini2.5: Summary: [Organizational, Individual] The organizational BeSafE program, implemented by sites, directly trained individual master coaches and trainers.
gemini2.5: Rationale: The paragraph describes the 'BeSafE programme' being rolled out by 'sites' (both Organizational scale elements). This programme explicitly 'includes training' specific 'master coaches and trainers' (Individual scale elements). This is a direct, explicit causal link from the Organizational scale to the Individual scale. While there is also an explicit link of 'master coaches and trainers' training 'employees', this is an Individual -> Individual interaction and therefore not included as per the protocol. Only two distinct scales (Organizational and Individual) were relevant for cross-scale links.

Full Paragraph Text: 2014 also saw some challenges. Our overall safety performance, as measured by the Total Recordable Frequency Rate (TRFR), increased slightly from 1.03 to 1.05 per 1 million hours worked due to a spike in injury rates in the first quarter of the year. With a renewed focus on safety programmes and initiatives, in co-operation with our project partners, injury rates have been brought back down since the first quarter.
claude4: Scale Explanations: Organizational: The company implementing safety programmes and initiatives; Inter-Organizational / Sector: Project partners collaborating with the company on safety measures
claude4: Summary: [Inter-Organizational / Sector, Organizational] Project partners cooperate with company to reduce injury rates through safety programmes.
claude4: Rationale: The paragraph describes explicit cooperation between project partners (Inter-Organizational) and the company (Organizational) that causally resulted in bringing injury rates down. This represents a clear cross-scale interaction where multiple organizations worked together to influence a single company's safety performance.
gpt5: Scale Explanations: Organizational: The company’s safety performance (TRFR) and injury rates are organizational metrics.; Inter-Organizational / Sector: Co-operation with project partners denotes collaboration among organizations.
gpt5: Summary: [Inter-Organizational / Sector -> Organizational] Collaboration with project partners on safety programs reduced the company’s injury rates.
gpt5: Rationale: The text explicitly ties inter-organizational cooperation on safety initiatives to reduced organizational injury rates. Other statements describe internal metrics changes only, which are same-scale and excluded.
o4_mini: Rationale: No explicit cross-scale causal links are present in the text; it discusses safety performance without indicating interactions between different scales.
gemini2.5: Scale Explanations: Individual: Injury rates reflect injuries sustained by specific workers, which are classified as individuals.; Organizational: The overall safety performance (TRFR) and the safety programmes/initiatives are attributes and actions of a single company.
gemini2.5: Summary: [Individual, Organizational] Organizational safety programs influenced individual injury rates, affecting organizational performance.
gemini2.5: Rationale: The paragraph explicitly details two cross-scale causal links. First, individual injury rates (Individual scale) directly caused a change in the organization's safety performance metric (Organizational scale). Second, the organization's safety programs (Organizational scale) explicitly reduced these individual injury rates. No Inter-Organizational link was included as 'in co-operation with' suggests collaboration rather than a direct hierarchical causal influence from project partners.

Full Paragraph Text: Women are Unilever’s core consumers, controlling nearly two thirds of consumer spending, so it’s important that we represent them in our workforce. In fact, 2014 marks five years since we began the process of building an agile and diverse Unilever and making sure we have the right gender balance throughout the organisation.
claude4: Scale Explanations: Individual: Women as consumers who control consumer spending decisions; Organizational: Unilever as a company implementing workforce diversity policies and organizational changes
claude4: Summary: [Individual, Organizational] Women consumers' spending power drives Unilever's workforce diversity initiatives.
claude4: Rationale: The paragraph establishes a clear causal link where individual consumer behavior (women controlling spending) explicitly influences organizational policy (Unilever's workforce diversity efforts). The company states this consumer influence is why representation is 'important' and drives their organizational changes.
gpt5: Scale Explanations: Individual: Women as specific consumers controlling spending; Organizational: Unilever adjusting workforce representation and gender balance
gpt5: Summary: [Individual, Organizational] Women consumers’ spending power drives Unilever to represent them in its workforce.
gpt5: Rationale: The text states consumer women’s control of spending, leading Unilever to prioritize representing them in its workforce. This is a direct causal link from individuals to the organization. No other cross-scale effects are explicitly described.
o4_mini: Scale Explanations: Individual: Women as consumers influence spending patterns.; Organizational: Unilever as an organization is working to represent these consumers in its workforce.
o4_mini: Summary: [Individual, Organizational] Women as consumers influence Unilever's workforce representation strategy.
o4_mini: Rationale: The link exists because the paragraph explicitly states that women, as core consumers, influence Unilever's approach to workforce diversity, creating a clear cross-scale interaction.
gemini2.5: Scale Explanations: Individual:  'Women' are described as 'core consumers' and 'controlling consumer spending', which maps to specific people or informal groups.; Organizational:  'Unilever' is explicitly a single company, and 'workforce' refers to an internal unit within that organization.
gemini2.5: Summary: [Individual, Organizational] Individual consumers' spending power explicitly influences Unilever's organizational efforts towards workforce representation.
gemini2.5: Rationale: The paragraph clearly establishes one cross-scale causal link. Women, as individual consumers with significant spending control, are presented as the reason ('so it's important') for Unilever's organizational decision to represent them in their workforce. This interaction moves from the Individual scale to the Organizational scale. No other explicit cross-scale links are present in the text, with the remainder describing internal organizational processes.

Full Paragraph Text: By the end of 2014, over 43% of our managers were women, up from 38% in 2010. The hard work we are doing to retain more women in our workforce by promoting flexible working, women’s networks, job shares and maternity and paternity support is paying benefit and will remain a focus area.
claude4: Scale Explanations: Organizational: The company implementing policies like flexible working, women's networks, job shares, and maternity/paternity support; Individual: Women employees who are being retained in the workforce and promoted to management positions
claude4: Summary: [Organizational, Individual] Company policies to retain women result in increased female management representation.
claude4: Rationale: The paragraph clearly describes how organizational-level policies and initiatives directly cause individual-level outcomes (retention of women employees and their advancement to management positions). The causal relationship is explicitly stated with 'is paying benefit' connecting the company's efforts to the workforce outcomes.
gpt5: Scale Explanations: Organizational: The company ('we') implements policies: flexible working, networks, job shares, parental support.; Individual: Women employees/managers whose retention and representation are affected.
gpt5: Summary: [Organizational, Individual] Company policies to retain women are paying off, influencing women employees’ retention/representation.
gpt5: Rationale: The text explicitly states the organization’s retention efforts are yielding benefits, implying impact on women employees. This is a direct cross-scale causal link from organizational actions to individuals; no other scales are implicated.
o4_mini: Rationale: The paragraph discusses internal organizational efforts without indicating any causal influence across different scales.
gemini2.5: Scale Explanations: Individual: Refers to 'women in our workforce' and 'our managers', specific people within the organization whose demographics and retention are being discussed.; Organizational: Refers to 'we' (the company) and its internal policies and initiatives ('flexible working', 'women’s networks', 'job shares', 'maternity and paternity support').
gemini2.5: Summary: [Individual, Organizational] Organizational policies and support directly influence the retention and representation of women at the individual level within the workforce.
gemini2.5: Rationale: The paragraph explicitly details how the 'Organizational' entity ('we') implements policies and initiatives ('flexible working', 'women’s networks', etc.) which directly cause changes at the 'Individual' level, specifically the 'retention of more women in our workforce' and the resulting increase in 'women managers'. Only two scales (Individual, Organizational) are present with clear causal interactions, well within the limit of three.

Full Paragraph Text: However, challenges remain. We have not made sufficient progress among the top 110 executive managers in the business, a group where just under 20% are women. If you include employees who are statutory directors of the corporate entities whose financial information is included in the Group’s 2014 consolidated accounts in this Annual Report and Accounts, the number increases to 592 males and 157 (21%) females.
claude4: Rationale: The paragraph presents statistical data about gender representation among executives and directors but does not describe any causal interactions between different scales. It only reports current demographic composition without indicating how actors at one scale influence actors at another scale.
gpt5: Scale Explanations: N/A
gpt5: Summary: N/A
gpt5: Rationale: The paragraph reports gender composition among executives and statutory directors but states no causal influence across different scales. It provides counts/percentages only, without cross-scale effects.
o4_mini: Rationale: No explicit causal influence across different scales is present in the text.
gemini2.5: Scale Explanations: Organizational: 'We' and 'the Group' refer to the single organization reporting its progress (or lack thereof).; Individual: 'women', 'males', and 'females' within managerial and directorship roles represent specific people whose demographic composition is being measured and discussed.
gemini2.5: Summary: [Organizational, Individual] An organization reported its failure to increase the representation of individual women in its management, indicating a lack of influence on individual-level diversity.
gemini2.5: Rationale: The paragraph explicitly states that 'We' (Organizational) have 'not made sufficient progress' in addressing the gender composition of 'women' (Individual) within its management. This indicates a failure of the organization to exert a desired causal influence on the demographic makeup of its individual employees. The latter part of the paragraph provides descriptive statistics without explicit causal links.

Full Paragraph Text: We are pleased though that 36% (five out of 14) of the Board are female which is over 40% of the Non-Executive Directors.
claude4: Rationale: This paragraph only presents statistical information about board composition (36% female directors, 40% of non-executive directors). No actors are described taking actions that causally influence other actors across different scales. It is purely descriptive data without any causal relationships.
gpt5: Scale Explanations: N/A
gpt5: Summary: N/A
gpt5: Rationale: The sentence reports gender composition of a board and its non-executive directors without stating any causal influence across scales.
o4_mini: Rationale: No explicit cross-scale causal interactions are present in the text.
gemini2.5: Scale Explanations: Individual: 'female' refers to specific people, and 'Non-Executive Directors' are individual roles.; Organizational: 'the Board' is a formal internal unit of a company, and 'We' implies the company itself.
gemini2.5: Summary: N/A
gemini2.5: Rationale: The paragraph describes the demographic composition of 'the Board' (Organizational) by stating the percentage of 'female' members and 'Non-Executive Directors' (Individual). It is a purely descriptive statement of a state, not an explicit causal influence or interaction between these different scales. No verbs or phrases indicating causality are present.

Full Paragraph Text: In 2014 we paid particular attention to mental health initiatives. The rising incidence of mental ill health in the UK is reflected in our absence data. Help and support on nutrition, sleep, exercise and mindfulness all improve the day-to-day well-being of employees. A robust framework with support tools is now in place and is being rolled out across the organisation.
claude4: Scale Explanations: Environmental and Societal: The rising incidence of mental ill health in the UK represents a societal-level trend affecting the broader population; Organizational: The company implementing mental health initiatives, support frameworks, and organizational rollout represents organizational-level action
claude4: Summary: [Environmental and Societal, Organizational] UK mental health trends prompt company to implement workplace wellness initiatives.
claude4: Rationale: The paragraph clearly establishes causality where a societal health trend (rising mental ill health in the UK) influences organizational response (mental health initiatives and support framework implementation). This represents a clear cross-scale interaction from societal level to organizational level.
gpt5: Links: Environmental and Societal -> Organizational | Organizational -> Individual
gpt5: Scale Explanations: Environmental and Societal: “Rising incidence of mental ill health in the UK” is a societal-level trend.; Organizational: “Our absence data” and “framework with support tools… rolled out across the organisation” are company-level.; Individual: “Employees” and their “day-to-day well-being” are specific people.
gpt5: Summary: [Environmental and Societal, Organizational, Individual] UK mental ill-health rises affect company absence data; company support initiatives improve employees’ well-being.
gpt5: Rationale: The text explicitly ties UK-wide mental ill-health to the firm's absence data (societal -> organizational). It also states that organizational support improves employees’ well-being (organizational -> individual). No other cross-scale effects are explicit.
o4_mini: Scale Explanations: Individual: Employees' well-being is directly influenced by mental health initiatives.; Organizational: The organization implements a framework to support these initiatives.
o4_mini: Summary: [Organizational, Individual] The organization's mental health initiatives enhance individual employee well-being.
o4_mini: Rationale: The link exists as the organizational framework directly influences the well-being of individual employees. No other scales were present.
gemini2.5: Links: Environmental and Societal -> Organizational | Organizational -> Individual
gemini2.5: Scale Explanations: Individual: Refers to 'employees' whose day-to-day well-being is improved by support.; Organizational: Refers to 'we', 'our absence data', 'the organisation', and the 'Help and support' provided by the entity.; Environmental and Societal: Refers to the 'rising incidence of mental ill health in the UK', a broader societal issue.
gemini2.5: Summary: [Environmental and Societal, Organizational, Individual] Societal mental health trends influence organizational data, prompting organizational support to improve individual employee well-being.
gemini2.5: Rationale: The paragraph explicitly links societal mental health trends to organizational data, showing an Environmental and Societal -> Organizational influence. Furthermore, the organization's initiatives directly improve individual employee well-being, indicating an Organizational -> Individual causal interaction. These two distinct cross-scale links are clearly stated through verbs like 'reflected in' and 'improve'.

Full Paragraph Text: In 2014 we published our Human Rights Policy Statement which contains over arching principles which are embedded into our policies and systems. A full version of the document can be read at www.unilever. com/humanrightspolicystatement.
claude4: Rationale: The paragraph only describes Unilever's publication of a policy statement and its embedding into systems. While this mentions organizational actions, there is no explicit causal influence described between different scales - no mention of how this policy affects individuals, other organizations, or societal systems, nor how external forces influenced the policy creation.
gpt5: Scale Explanations: N/A
gpt5: Summary: N/A
gpt5: Rationale: The text only describes an organization (Unilever) publishing and embedding a policy within its own systems. No explicit causal effects across different scales are stated.
o4_mini: Rationale: The paragraph does not contain any explicit causal interactions between different hierarchical scales.
gemini2.5: Scale Explanations: Organizational: The 'we' refers to Unilever, a single company. Its 'Human Rights Policy Statement', 'principles', 'policies', and 'systems' are all internal components or actions of this organization.
gemini2.5: Summary: N/A
gemini2.5: Rationale: The paragraph describes internal actions of a single company (Unilever), specifically the publication of a Human Rights Policy Statement and the embedding of its principles into internal policies and systems. All mentioned actors and their interactions occur exclusively within the Organizational scale, thus no explicit cross-scale causal links are present.

Full Paragraph Text: We believe that business can only flourish in societies where human rights are protected and respected. We recognise that business has the responsibility to respect human rights and has the ability to contribute to a positive impact on human rights.
claude4: Rationale: The paragraph presents general beliefs and principles about business responsibility regarding human rights, but does not describe any specific actors taking concrete actions that causally influence actors at different scales. The statements are philosophical positions rather than explicit causal relationships between identifiable entities.
gpt5: Links: Environmental and Societal -> Inter-Organizational / Sector | Inter-Organizational / Sector -> Environmental and Societal
gpt5: Scale Explanations: Environmental and Societal: ‘Societies where human rights are protected and respected’ refers to societal-level norms and systems.; Inter-Organizational / Sector: ‘Business’ is referenced generically as a sector-level actor.
gpt5: Summary: [Environmental and Societal | Inter-Organizational / Sector] Societal human-rights conditions enable business flourishing; the business sector can positively impact human rights.
gpt5: Rationale: The text explicitly ties societal human-rights protection to business flourishing and also claims the business sector can improve human rights. These are direct cross-scale causal links using only two scales.
o4_mini: Scale Explanations: Organizational: Business entities have responsibilities and capabilities.; Environmental and Societal: Human rights are a societal-level concern.
o4_mini: Summary: [Organizational, Environmental and Societal] Business can positively impact human rights, which are societal concerns.
o4_mini: Rationale: The link exists because the paragraph explicitly states that businesses have responsibilities regarding human rights, which are societal-level issues. No other scales are involved.
gemini2.5: Links: Environmental and Societal -> Inter-Organizational / Sector | Inter-Organizational / Sector -> Environmental and Societal
gemini2.5: Scale Explanations: Inter-Organizational / Sector: 'Business' refers to the collective economic activity or sector, not a single organization, thus fitting the inter-organizational scale.; Environmental and Societal: 'Societies' and 'human rights' explicitly represent societal-level systems and norms.
gemini2.5: Summary: [Inter-Organizational / Sector, Environmental and Societal] Business flourishing depends on societal human rights protection, and business has the ability to positively impact human rights.
gemini2.5: Rationale: The paragraph explicitly details two-way causal interactions between the Inter-Organizational / Sector (business) and Environmental and Societal scales (societies, human rights). One link describes how societal conditions enable business, while the other describes business's capacity to influence societal conditions. Only two distinct scales are involved, so no limitation was applied.

Full Paragraph Text: This is an area of growing importance to our employees, shareholders, customers, consumers, the communities where we operate and civil society groups.
claude4: Rationale: The paragraph lists various stakeholders (employees, shareholders, customers, consumers, communities, civil society groups) but only describes their shared interest in an unspecified area of 'growing importance.' No explicit causal relationships or actions are described between any actors at different scales - it's purely descriptive of stakeholder interest without any cross-scale influence or causality.
gpt5: Scale Explanations: N/A
gpt5: Summary: N/A
gpt5: Rationale: The sentence lists stakeholders for whom an issue is important but states no causal influence between actors at different scales.
o4_mini: Rationale: No explicit causal interactions across different scales are present in the text.
gemini2.5: Scale Explanations: N/A
gemini2.5: Summary: N/A
gemini2.5: Rationale: The paragraph lists various stakeholders (employees, shareholders, customers, consumers, communities, civil society groups) for 'an area of growing importance'. While these actors map to different scales (Individual, Environmental and Societal), the text only describes who finds 'this area' important. It does not state any explicit causal influence or action flowing from one scale to another, which is a requirement for a valid link.

Full Paragraph Text: There is therefore both a business and a moral case for ensuring that human rights are upheld across our operations and our value chain. In giving effect to our Human Rights Policy Statement, we continue to raise awareness, build capacity and engage with others to address root causes and provide remedies where needed.
claude4: Scale Explanations: Organizational: The company ('our operations') implementing human rights policies and taking specific actions; Inter-Organizational / Sector: The company's value chain representing multiple interconnected organizations
claude4: Summary: [Organizational, Inter-Organizational / Sector] Company implements human rights policies across its operations and value chain.
claude4: Rationale: The paragraph describes a company taking action to uphold human rights both internally and across its value chain. This represents clear organizational influence extending to the inter-organizational level through value chain engagement.
gpt5: Scale Explanations: N/A
gpt5: Summary: N/A
gpt5: Rationale: The paragraph describes intentions (raising awareness, engaging with others) and goals (upholding human rights) but does not state an explicit causal effect across different scales. Any cross-scale impacts are implied, not explicitly causal.
o4_mini: Scale Explanations: Organizational: The text refers to the operations and policies of a specific organization.; Inter-Organizational / Sector: The mention of the value chain implies interactions with other organizations.
o4_mini: Summary: [Organizational, Inter-Organizational / Sector] The organization's commitment to human rights impacts its value chain interactions.
o4_mini: Rationale: The link exists because the organization's policies directly affect its value chain, which includes other organizations. No additional scales were necessary as the focus remained on these two.
gemini2.5: Scale Explanations: Organizational: 'we' refers to the company itself, and 'our operations' are internal company activities.; Inter-Organizational: 'our value chain' explicitly refers to systems or collaborations among organizations. 'others' in the context of the value chain is interpreted as the collective of entities within this inter-organizational system.
gemini2.5: Summary: [Organizational, Inter-Organizational] The company influences its value chain through awareness, capacity building, and engagement to address human rights issues.
gemini2.5: Rationale: The company (Organizational) actively engages with and influences 'others' within its 'value chain' (Inter-Organizational) by raising awareness and building capacity. This demonstrates a clear cross-scale interaction where a single organization directly impacts a broader network of organizations that constitute its value chain to uphold human rights.

Full Paragraph Text: In 2014 we strengthened the enhancing livelihoods ambition of the USLP. An integral part of this is our implementation of the UN Guiding Principle on Business and Human Rights and our public reporting on this. We also committed to enhancing access to training and skills for women and to advancing women’s rights. A key aspect of this has been our safety programme for women and girls, with the involvement of men and boys, which we have begun at our tea plantation in Kericho, Kenya, in response to reports of sexual harassment in 2013. The programme is being rolled out to other locations. More information on our progress on women’s rights is in the Society section on pages 22 to 24, with full details to be published in our Sustainable Living Report 2014 which will be found on www.unilever.com/sustainable-living in May 2015.
claude4: Scale Explanations: Individual: Reports of sexual harassment in 2013 represent individual-level experiences and complaints; Organizational: Unilever as a company implementing safety programmes and policy responses at their tea plantation
claude4: Summary: [Individual, Organizational] Sexual harassment reports prompted Unilever to implement safety programme at tea plantation.
claude4: Rationale: The paragraph clearly describes how individual reports of sexual harassment in 2013 caused Unilever (organizational level) to respond by implementing a safety programme. This represents explicit cross-scale causality from individual experiences to organizational policy action.
gpt5: Scale Explanations: Individual: Reports of sexual harassment by people at the plantation; Organizational: Unilever/its tea plantation initiating a safety programme
gpt5: Summary: [Individual, Organizational] Reports of sexual harassment led Unilever to start a safety programme at its Kericho tea plantation.
gpt5: Rationale: The text explicitly ties individuals’ reports of harassment to the organization launching a safety programme. Other statements (e.g., implementing UN principles) lack explicit cross-scale causality, so were excluded.
o4_mini: Scale Explanations: Organizational: The actions taken by Unilever as a company to enhance women's rights and safety.; Environmental and Societal: The broader societal implications of women's rights and safety in communities affected by Unilever's operations.
o4_mini: Summary: [Organizational, Environmental and Societal] Unilever's safety programs for women impact societal norms on women's rights.
o4_mini: Rationale: The link exists as Unilever's organizational actions to enhance women's safety and rights have a direct influence on societal norms and conditions. No other distinct scales were present.
gemini2.5: Links: Environmental and Societal -> Organizational | Organizational -> Individual | Individual -> Organizational
gemini2.5: Scale Explanations: Individual: Refers to 'women and girls', 'men and boys', and 'reports of sexual harassment' stemming from individual experiences.; Organizational: Refers to 'we' (the company/Unilever), 'USLP', 'our tea plantation', and 'safety programme' as initiatives/entities of the organization.; Environmental and Societal: Refers to 'the UN Guiding Principle on Business and Human Rights' as a global norm/standard influencing organizations.
gemini2.5: Summary: [Individual, Organizational, Environmental and Societal] Individual reports of harassment led to an Organizational safety program, which is also influenced by Environmental/Societal norms and benefits Individuals.
gemini2.5: Rationale: The paragraph explicitly details three cross-scale interactions. The Environmental and Societal 'UN Guiding Principle' informs 'our implementation' (Organizational). The 'we' (Organizational) committed actions benefiting 'women and girls' (Individual). Crucially, 'reports of sexual harassment' (Individual) directly led to the 'safety programme' (Organizational). All three scales are explicitly involved in these causal influences.

Full Paragraph Text: This Strategic Report lays out how Unilever’s business works, the highlights of 2014 and the underlying importance of the Unilever Sustainable Living Plan (USLP), to ensure that our business will remain relevant to future generations of consumers and investors. The following pages reveal how this adds up to sustainable value for shareholders.
claude4: Scale Explanations: Organizational: Unilever as a company implementing the USLP business strategy; Individual: Future generations of consumers and investors as specific people who will be influenced by the company's sustainability approach
claude4: Summary: [Organizational, Individual] Unilever's sustainability plan ensures relevance to future consumers and investors.
claude4: Rationale: The paragraph describes how Unilever (organizational scale) implements the USLP specifically to influence and remain relevant to future consumers and investors (individual scale). This represents a clear cross-scale causal relationship where organizational strategy directly targets individual stakeholder relevance.
gpt5: Scale Explanations: Organizational: Unilever and its Unilever Sustainable Living Plan (company and internal program).; Individual: Shareholders, consumers, and investors are people/groups of people.
gpt5: Summary: [Organizational, Individual] Unilever’s strategy creates sustainable value for shareholders.
gpt5: Rationale: The text explicitly states that the organizational strategy results in value for shareholders, a cross-scale causal effect. Other mentions (relevance to consumers/investors) are similar but would duplicate the same scale pair, so only one link is kept.
o4_mini: Scale Explanations: Organizational: Unilever is a specific organization whose actions are described.; Environmental and Societal: The mention of future generations of consumers and investors indicates a societal-level impact.
o4_mini: Summary: [Organizational, Environmental and Societal] Unilever's actions through the USLP influence future generations of consumers and investors.
o4_mini: Rationale: The link exists as Unilever's strategic actions are aimed at ensuring relevance for future societal needs, thus creating a clear cross-scale interaction. No other scales were present in the text.
gemini2.5: Links: Organizational -> Individual | Organizational -> Individual | Organizational -> Individual
gemini2.5: Scale Explanations: Organizational: Unilever’s business and the Unilever Sustainable Living Plan (USLP) represent a single organization and its internal initiatives.; Individual: Future generations of consumers, investors, and shareholders refer to specific people or informal groups directly impacted by the business.
gemini2.5: Summary: [Organizational, Individual] Unilever's business and strategic plans influence relevance and sustainable value for individual consumers, investors, and shareholders, demonstrating a clear cross-scale interaction.
gemini2.5: Rationale: The paragraph explicitly links Unilever's internal strategies and business activities (Organizational) to their direct impact on individual consumers, investors, and shareholders. The Unilever Sustainable Living Plan aims to ensure relevance for these individuals, and the company's overall activities generate sustainable value for shareholders. This demonstrates a clear causal flow from the organizational level to the individual level, involving only two distinct scales as per the protocol definitions.

Full Paragraph Text: At Unilever we look to the future and what the consumer of tomorrow will need. This has inevitably drawn us to increase our business in emerging markets where population and consumption growth offer attractive opportunities. In 2014, 57% of our turnover was generated in emerging markets.
claude4: Rationale: The paragraph describes Unilever's strategic business decisions and market positioning but does not establish explicit causal relationships between different scales. While it mentions consumers (Individual scale) and Unilever as a company (Organizational scale), there is no clear causality stated - only business strategy and market observations about opportunities and turnover distribution.
gpt5: Scale Explanations: Environmental and Societal: Population and consumption growth in emerging markets are societal-level conditions.; Organizational: Unilever is a single company making strategic expansion decisions.
gpt5: Summary: [Environmental and Societal, Organizational] Societal population and consumption growth led Unilever to expand business in emerging markets.
gpt5: Rationale: The text explicitly links societal growth conditions to Unilever’s decision to expand. Other statements (e.g., turnover share) are internal outcomes and not cross-scale causal links.
o4_mini: Scale Explanations: Organizational: Unilever is a specific organization making strategic decisions.; Environmental and Societal: Emerging markets represent broader societal trends affecting population and consumption.
o4_mini: Summary: [Organizational, Environmental and Societal] Unilever's business strategy is shaped by growth opportunities in emerging markets.
o4_mini: Rationale: The link exists as Unilever's organizational decisions are directly influenced by societal trends in emerging markets, which are characterized by population and consumption growth.
gemini2.5: Links: Individual -> Organizational | Environmental and Societal -> Organizational
gemini2.5: Scale Explanations: Individual: 'consumer of tomorrow' refers to specific people whose needs drive decisions.; Organizational: 'Unilever', 'us', and 'our business' refer to a single company and its operations.; Environmental and Societal: 'emerging markets' (as a context for growth), 'population growth', and 'consumption growth' represent broader societal and economic trends.
gemini2.5: Summary: [Individual, Organizational, Environmental and Societal] Consumer needs and societal growth trends in emerging markets drive Unilever's organizational strategy to increase its business.
gemini2.5: Rationale: The paragraph explicitly links the future needs of individual consumers to Unilever's strategic outlook (Individual -> Organizational). Subsequently, broader societal trends like population and consumption growth are presented as opportunities that draw Unilever (Organizational) to expand its business (Environmental and Societal -> Organizational). All three scales are involved in these clear causal influences.

Full Paragraph Text: These markets also bring challenges. Performance can prove volatile as witnessed in 2014. Economies have slowed and exchange rates have weakened leading to a reduction in consumer spending.

Full Paragraph Text: Our long-term track record of delivery for shareholders continued during 2014 despite some significant challenges in the business environment. These included continued weak consumer demand in developed markets, slowing demand in emerging markets and currency devaluations in many countries. The resilience of our business and the broad nature of our brand portfolio and geographic reach enabled us to deliver a year of steady progress in slower markets.

Full Paragraph Text: We are also working with Water & Sanitation for the Urban Poor (WSUP) to develop innovative sanitation businesses and promote hygiene communications to millions of the poorest consumers in Ghana, Bangladesh, Kenya and Zambia.
claude4: Scale Explanations: Organizational: WSUP is identified as a specific organization/NGO that the speaker is collaborating with; Individual: References to 'millions of the poorest consumers' as specific people receiving services and communications
claude4: Summary: [Organizational, Individual] WSUP develops sanitation services and communications reaching millions of poor consumers.
claude4: Rationale: The paragraph clearly describes an organizational actor (WSUP) taking specific actions (developing businesses, promoting communications) that directly impact individual-level actors (poorest consumers). This represents a clear cross-scale causal relationship from organizational to individual level.

Full Paragraph Text: And we are providing support through the Domestos Toilet Academy, a market-based model that improves sanitation in India and Vietnam. By the end of 2014 there were ten Domestos Toilet Academies open, eight in India and two in Vietnam. The Academies train entrepreneurs to form businesses supplying, installing and maintaining hygienic toilets. The initiative will train 250 entrepreneurs and supply 51,000 toilets by the end of 2015.
claude4: Scale Explanations: Organizational: Domestos Toilet Academy is a formal program/initiative run by an organization; Individual: Entrepreneurs are specific people being trained to form businesses
claude4: Summary: [Organizational, Individual] Domestos Toilet Academy trains entrepreneurs to form sanitation businesses.
claude4: Rationale: The paragraph describes a clear causal relationship where an organizational program (Domestos Toilet Academy) directly trains and enables individual entrepreneurs to start businesses. This represents explicit cross-scale causality from organizational to individual level.
